The other three verses are:

My Heart says this is very Beautiful Spiritual Song. Thank you. Seeking is a doing word, we put forward the desire to become more alike Him, by allowing Him to change us within our hearts, little by little, day by day, seeking His Righteousness leads us to His Kingdom. It’s interesting that it says Seek “First” and not just to seek. Thus it was written “You shall seek me, and find me”, when you search for me, with all your heart”. Asking and Knocking are doing words also. With tears in my eyes, I ask our Father in Heaven, that I may be transformed little by little, day by day, as He leads me to see how he wants me to change, I ask not for myself but that I may love others more, as according to His word, I also “knock” by reminding Him that “he promised” us that “we will find him”. Therefore I pray for the right intention to seek first His Kingdom and His Character, with my whole heart. Yaakov

I was reading Luke 12:13-31 (parable of the rich fool) and thought of this hymn. The key is to understand the Hebrew word translated 'righteousness' - 'tzedakah'. The rich man should have sought after God's righteousness/charity/equality by sharing his wealth with orphans, widows and foreigners rather than keeping it to himself. May His kingdom come and may we be those who bring it forward. Deut. 15:7-11; Deut. 26:12; Deut. 27:19; James 1:27.

Sometimes, I get so distracted...seeking the things of the world..even those which seemingly are the things you just need. But today, I am reminded to see HIM, to seek HIS righteousness, seek the kingdom of God and ALL these things (which I apparently need) will be added. Furthermore, I am reminded to be content with the things the Lord has given and with the things that the Lord has allowed to depart from me. In the end, all things work together for good. Lord, open my eyes!! to see what you are after...not my own petty needs...Lord Jesus, enlarge my heart...enlarge my view...broaden my horizon. My life is yours. I love YOU!
